entities.name: the egg
entities.description: The egg is mentioned as singing a song, 'Come seek us where our voices sound...'. The text describes the egg's song as being underwater and not audible above ground. The egg's song is repeated three times for Harry to memorize it.

entities.name: the eye
entities.description: The eye is mentioned in the title of the poem, 'THE EGG AND THE EYE'. However, there is no further mention or description of the eye in the text.

entities.name: Harry
entities.description: Harry is a person who is listening to the egg's song and trying to memorize it. He breaks the surface of the water and shakes his hair out of his eyes after hearing the song.

entities.name: Myrtle
entities.description: Myrtle is a person who is with Harry in the water. She asks him if he heard the egg's song and seems to be waiting for him to figure out what it means.

relationships.description: Harry is listening to the egg's song, which he tries to memorize after hearing it three times.
Myrtle is watching Harry as he tries to figure out what the egg's song means.
